definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: The people's war has helped crush the feudal structure in the rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 人民战争摧毁了农村地区的封建制度。

sentences.english: We should develop small towns on the Basis of existing county seats and of organic towns where conditions permit.
sentences.chinese: 发展小城镇要以现有的县城和有条件的建制镇为基础。

sentences.english: But it was also a bold attack on feudalism and arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但它同时也是对封建制度和包办婚姻的一记猛击。

sentences.english: In the architecture, the old building like Cosmological temple was built according to the idea of "Round Sky & Square Earth".
sentences.chinese: 在建制上，古代的建筑样式如明堂就拟天圆地方而建。

sentences.english: They are the hieroglyphics of feudalism succeeding those of theocracy .
sentences.chinese: 这是继神权政治象形文字之后的封建制度象形文字。

sentences.english: Their victims from the feudal system, become the accomplices of the feudal rulers.
sentences.chinese: 她们由封建制度的受害者，变成封建统治者的帮凶。

sentences.english: We will improve the system for managing government investment, and accelerate implementation of the contractor system for construction projects.
sentences.chinese: 健全政府投资管理体制，加快推行代建制。

sentences.english: Feudal and monarchical maladies no longer run in our blood.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的血液里已不再存在封建制和君主制的病害。

sentences.english: The process and driving model of institutionalization for the discipline are discussed here.
sentences.chinese: 分析了消防工程学科建制化的过程及其驱动模式。

sentences.english: The fall of the West Rome Empire marked the beginning of feudalism in Eurpoe.
sentences.chinese: 西罗马帝国的灭亡标志着欧洲封建制度的开始。

sentences.english: Refers to cities establish with the approval of the central government.
sentences.chinese: 指经国家批准成立的“市”建制的城市。

sentences.english: Feudal economic structure formulated in Warring States period.
sentences.chinese: 战国秦汉时期是我国封建制度的奠基时期。

sentences.english: A number of slips record the discussion about the administrative establishment of Dongting Prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 其中还有多枚简涉及对洞庭郡某一行政建制的讨论。

sentences.english: Shi, according to records, the Xia and Shang Dynasties period began Wuqiang officially formed in the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 据史志记载，武强始于夏商时期，正式建制于两汉。

sentences.english: Withdrawn in 1950 the establishment of Dalian University, Dalian Medical College independent.
sentences.chinese: 1950年撤消大连大学建制，大连医学院独立。

sentences.english: The approval for the government injection into the Community Care Fund hinged on support from pro-establishment legislators.
sentences.chinese: 关爱基金拨款获批与否，取决于建制派议员的支持。

definition: to expand (esp. by new recruitment)/to increase the army/to augment
to establish (a unit or department)/staffing structure (excluding temporary and casual staff)
to weave/to plait/to compile/to put together (a lesson plan, budget etc)
to govern/to control/having jurisdiction over/linchpin of a wheel (archaic)/noise of a barrow
to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
to belong to (a category)/to be attached to
